lesson: Today we will learn about Java syntax. If you write 'private' the field won't be accessible out of the class. If you declare a variable of a certain type, you can't affect it another type. Don't forget to add ';' at the end of every line of code. This is it for this POO lesson, see you for another one.

questions.question: Can 'private String name;' be access out of the class ?
If I declare 'private String a;' can I do 'a = 3' ?

Does it compile :
 private String s
private String b; ?
';' isn't necessary at the end of every line of code. T or F?
If you write 'private' the field won't be accessible out of the class. T or F?
